intro: Mecodium funckii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, palmately lobed, and often covered in fine hairs. Mecodium funckii is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
